title: @Meddler: Goals for veigar post patch 5.6
body:
Since yer lurking in the forums atm, I thought I'd ask your thoughts concerning our favorite master of evil.

As the patch notes for patch 5.6 have just been released, and the veigar changes are locked in place, what exactly is the plan for veigar from here on out?

Like, I know you recently said something along the lines of wanting to preserve veig's identity as a single target burst mage, but with all of his (non-ult) dmg being skill shots, how do you intend to keep him from switching over to a standard poke-mage-with-strong-burst (ala syndra) role?

Ever since the nerfs to veigar's E the community has been begging for having his W's delay reduced so that he doesn't have to rely on his stun to land it anymore. But I'm concerned that doing so will actually harm his identity as a burst mage. But at the same time, his W really feels like half a spell without his E to land it reliably.

Also, since veig's Q has been able to hit 2 creeps for a while now, do you  have any data to share with us showing just how much the average stacks as increased? Do these numbers seem low, high? expected, unexpected?

And finally, after this patch goes through, what are your hopes it will have for veigar? How much of an impact do you think they will have on him?

Actually, {{champion:134}} is a burst mage. More fun to play than the current {{champion:45}}. Her Q is much easier to hit (since it deals damage to all enemies) and has a shorter cooldown at all ranks. She has a higher range, and doesn't rely on her stun that much. And her ult deals way more Damage than Veigar's (against non-AP champions).
With just 840 AP, {{champion:134}} can deal a maximum of 1260 + (140% AP) = 1260 + 1176 = 2436 damage with just a click (assuming she spawned 4 more spheres) on a higher range (750 range) at level 16. While {{champion:45}} has a base damage of 500 + (100% AP ratio), he can only reach 2436 if he gets around 1963 AP from items + Q, which is impossible unless the game lasts 2 hours or longer. Even {{champion:134}}'s minimum damage at lvl 16 deals more base damage than Veigar's ult (540).
I remember destroying too many pre-nerf {{champion:45}} in mid. Didn't even have a hard against them, they fed me so much + I rushed a bit tanky (RoA) so I wouldn't get bursted from their 80% enemy ap ratio on their ult. Even when their jungler ganked, I still got either {{champion:45}} or both without dying.

Currently {{champion:134}} is my favorite champion because she's also a **"Single Target Burst Mage"** and still able to teamfight after using her ult, unlike pre-nerf and the current {{champion:134}} who either dies after killing 1 champion or just watch the teamfight since he can't do anything anyways.

But, if they nerf {{champion:134}}.... I'll be so fking done with this game. I'm playing her atm mostly because her lore matches her playstyle (a dark sovereign bringing destruction and fear to the battlefield with her immense powers) unlike {{champion:45}} who's only good at speaking and telling fairy tales.

syndra has too much range/utility/aoe to be called a dedicated single target burst mage. She falls more closely under the hybrid category poke/burst mage. This conversation isn't about how "effective" veigar is/was/should be.

The conversation is about veigar's ***play style*** and how it is unsatisfying, unrewarding, and currently undesirable compared to how he used to be.

Out of all 120+ champs in league, veigar was the ultimate "delete" button. His role, the main reason you pick him for your team comp, is to simply out and out remove one enemy champ from a team fight. Veigar used to do this very well, even with DFG removed. But now it is impossible for him to do so in a satisfying/rewarding way. Riot's attempt to give veig counter play has gone to the other extreme. Now he has ***too much*** counter play, and must rely on the mistakes of his opponents rather than making plays on his own.

Also, in a game where dodging is a key skill, landing skill shots can never be considered "all skill" as the higher you get in elo, the better ppl are at dodging. This means that if you **do** land a skill shot, it wasn't because you aim well, as much as it was your opponent just didn't dodge well enough. So the key response to, "if landing a skill shot is all me" is simpley "throw more at them till something sticks!" And that is the spot veigar is in atm. Just throw everything at the enemy till **something** hits, which means he is no longer a true burst mage, and is now more of a poke mage with an almost identical role on a team as syndra.
